It lays the foundations for tangible projects, impact-driven start-ups and long-lasting conversations with decision-makers around city plans and policies. The next global Climathon campaign  will have a mix of physical, digital and hybrid formats, plus Young Climathons aimed at youth networks and secondary schoolchildren.
Bluedot collates and analyzes sources such as local news and other databases, in order to identify emerging health risks such as pandemics.
A team of fact checkers prioritizes statement made by influential sources and posts the assessment online, ready to be picked up and shared by social media and other information platforms on the web.

Shares is an investment app and social community for any investor to make trades, manage their portfolio, and discuss opportunities with friends. With Shares, family, friends and seasoned investors can invest together, sharing knowledge and experience to inspire long-term growth in their investments.

Use case: Provide environmental data through a decentralized web3 platform
Description: dClimate is a transparent, decentralized marketplace where climate data, forecasts, and models are standardized, monetized, and distributed. The marketplace connects data publishers directly with data consumers, making climate data more accessible and reliable. When data providers share data and forecasts with the market it is automatically scored for reliability, which helps consumers to shop for information. In exchange, dClimate creates a simple, direct-to-consumer distribution mechanism to monetize their work. dClimate's base layer is built on Ethereum, and the network leverages Chainlink's leading decentralized oracle network to  facilitate on-chain validation and support for dClimate's governance layer. dClimate starts on day one with a foundation of dozens of terabytes of standardized climate data ready for institutional use and anchor-client Arbol, a leading parametric weather risk platform.

Crowd-based intelligence, such as Open Source Intelligence (OSINT), is facilitated by tools like InVid, Google Reverse Image Search, TinEye, RevEye, Yandex, Baidu, Google Lens, Exiftool, Redfin, Amnesty Video verification, and Trulymedia.
Existing pictures of a person can be used to find other places on the web where that person's picture have been posted. Open source intelligence uses this method. Privacy concerns are obvious.

Use case: Make nature-based climate credits more trustworthy
Description: Digital Gaia focuses on verifiability of nature-based solutions for climate offsets. It augments the power of a community of contributors (carbon offset project developers, data providers, data engineers) and integrates real world data with natural models to continuously evaluate regenerative project’s real global impact–from proposal to execution. It does so by using Web3 blockchain technology. It is inspired by the work of renown neuroscientist Karl Friston on active inference and minimization of free energy to optimize predictions.

Use case: Research biology through open database of proteome data
Description: OpenCell is a proteome-scale collection of protein localization and interaction measurements in human cells made thanks to CRISPR technology. It is built upon a library of 1,310 endogenously-tagged HEK293T cell lines that enables researchers to observe both protein localization (using live-cell fluorescence microscopy) and protein-protein interactions (using IP-MS) in the same cellular context.

Use case: Connect applications through API to form a network
Description: Financial services are notoriously fragmented, which prevents users are providers from benefit from network effects across steps of a financial transaction (e.g. credit assessment, underwriting, balance payment tracking etc). Plaid provides different technology and service providers with APIs that enable that connectivity.

Use case: Fight fake information online by betting against it
Description: Ideamarket encourages people to bet on credible information, in order to weed out misleading/fake one. Its principle is that the wisdom of the crowd would make it expensive to bet in favor of information that over time may be deemed wrong.

Use case: Spread Ukraine war news to Russians
Description: During the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022, Russian media de facto censored all news about the war. A Norwegian programmer created a dedicated "spam" platform that enables individual people to send up to 150 emails to Russian citizens email IDs, with the text that raises awareness.
UK based Streetbank is a platform that helps neighbors share assets, tools, skills between each other; and dispose of unwanted items with others.

BorrowMyDoggy is an internet platform that connects dog owners with trusted local people who love to look after dogs. From walks, playtime, and overnight stays on holidays, anyone can sign up to BorrowMyDoggy.

Use case: Attract and distribute resources for defense
Description: UkraineDAO is a funding and routing decentralized autonomous organization set up by activists groups to support Ukraine's military and civilians during the Russian invasion in 2022

Jakarta has seen a radical transformation of its public transport since 2010, which has greatly improved traffic conditions. Key leverage points in this change have been (a) making the transport modes more interoperable (e.g. through integrated maps and payments) and (b) shifting incentives for private transportation providers from fee-per-passenger to fee-per-kilometer which made driving safer. Additionally, cycling lanes were improved, making the system more holistically usable.

DALL·E is a 12-billion parameter version of GPT-3 trained to generate images from text descriptions, using a dataset of text–image pairs. It has a diverse set of capabilities, including creating anthropomorphized versions of animals and objects, combining unrelated concepts in plausible ways, rendering text, and applying transformations to existing images.

Use case: Allocate free accommodation to the needy
Description: Airbnb.org's mission is to partner with their community to offer housing in emergencies, from natural disasters to COVID-19. It was for instance used to match supply and demand of accommodation in the aftermath of Ukraine's war refugees surge in Europe.
Meetup.com enables people to quickly find an extensive set of people with similar interests, both in person or virtually.

Use case: Promote environmental agenda to the US government
Description: Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) is a nonprofit, nonpartisan, grassroots advocacy climate change organization focused on national policies to address the climate movement. Their consistently respectful, nonpartisan approach to climate education is designed to create a broad, sustainable foundation for climate action across all geographic regions and political inclinations. By building upon shared values rather than partisan divides, and empowering supporters to work in keeping with the concerns of their local communities, they work towards the adoption of fair, effective, and sustainable climate change solutions. In order to generate the political will necessary for passage of the Energy Innovation and Carbon Dividend Act they train and support volunteers to build relationships with elected officials, the media and their local community.

Use case: Improve scientists' incentives through Web3 NFTs
Description: Currently, scientists’ reputations — and as a result their ability to secure funding — are tied to publishing metrics. With blockchain technology, scientists could earn NFTs for doing other activities that research communities deem valuable, such as peer review, training and mentoring, and sharing data openly. NFT collections could act as a verifiable digital reputation for contributions, further incentivizing such behaviors. Scientists and groups of individuals with a shared wallet, such as a decentralized lab, could build reputation this way. (Source: Sarah Hamburg)

Use case: Launch crowdsourced cyberattacks during military conflict
Description: During the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022, a reported 300,000 global and self-organized non-combatants supported cyberattacks on Russian IT infrastructure.

During the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022, millions of Ukrainians escaped their country. The safety of escape routes were constantly challenged by the fighting. Volunteers took on themselves to use imagery and open source intelligence to update routes that could be more safely followed in order to exit the country.
https://www.frogid.net.au/ empowers volunteers in the field to log sightings, so that other volunteers can study patterns that might hold clues on the depletion of natural stock of frogs.

Microreact is a cloud-based system that combines the power of open data and the web, to provide real-time global data sharing and visualisation, allowing anyone to explore and examine outbreak information with unprecedented speed and detail. This is becoming increasingly important in the race to monitor and control fast-developing outbreaks like Ebola or Zika, or the growing threat of anti-microbial resistance. Microreact allows data and metadata sets to be uploaded via a web browser, which can then be visualised, shared and published in a research paper via a permanent web link. The partnership with Microbial Genomics allows the journal to make data from prospective publications available through Microreact. This promotes open availability and access while also starting to build a unique resource for global health professionals and scientists.

Use case: Use open-source energy data to improve forecasts
Description: In 2022, the International Energy Agency (IEA) announced that it would make much of its data sets open for the public to access and use for modeling, in the hope of improving cost and availability predictions among others. This is an important step in enabling communities to study countermeasures to climate change. The agency is funded mostly by governments, and has been criticized in the past because its predictions of renewable costs (particularly solar) systematically overshot the actual outcomes, making the renewables transition feel in some cases more expensive than it would actually be.

Use case: Pool solar power generation through web3
Description: India based Sunday Grids helps people who can't install solar on their roof participate in solar panel deployments that take place in more conducive places (such as industrial roofs). The contributions are tokenized through blockchain and the respective returns accrue to the token holders which can then use them offset power bills. A dashboard provides a continuous stream of information about the yield of the facilities installed.

Metahistory's "museum of war" documents the development of Ukraine's invasion through a timeline of blockchain non-fungible tokens (NFTs) created by artists every day. The funding from sponsors is channeled to the Ukrainian government.

Use case: Use traditional cultures' knowledge to enrich modern science
Description: Traditional cultures' knowledge accumulated over thousands of years with limited contact with the West (for instance Amazonas Indians medecines or Australian natives fire control methods), is increasingly used as a source of valuable information that can complement, add to, and give inspiration to modern science.

Use case: Connect science to funding in a decentralized manner
Description: Molecule is creating collaborative ecosystems, where stakeholders in drug development can work together to expedite the process of bringing novel therapeutics to patients. They are connecting leading researchers to funding by turning intellectual property and its development into a liquid and easily investable asset.

Use case: Track indigenous populations' environment through web3
Description: Indigenous people make up 6% of the global population, while their traditional indigenous territories make up 80% of the planet’s biodiversity. This platform will enable Indigenous communities to monitor their ecosystems with remote sensing and immutable storage of data. Community proposals submitted to a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) will be evaluated on several categories selected by the members.

Whalesafe combines all data (including crowdsourced) about whale presence in the Santa Barbara, CA, region, and notify large vessels in that region so that they can reduce their speed to help reduce the risk of collision. The compliance of vessels is then reported publicly.

Use case: Improving human's skills by playing against AI
Description: Research indicates that professional Go players playing against AI improved their games, especially if they were younger and more open to new strategies. https://hyokang.com/assets/pdf/CKKK-AI-Go.pdf

Use case: Improve human performance through crowdsourced AR (concept)
Description: A builder could be guided on his work by a more-experience, perhaps even retired, remote colleague who is working from home: both use augmented reality goggles to see what each other sees. 4G and certainly 5G make the transmission of data fast and detailed. This model can be applied to any field where an in-field operator may lack the skills to deal with unusual circumstances, while a remote pool of experts can serve multiple in-field operators. Applications can range from remote healthcare through paramedics and first responders, to installation of new climate-neutral energy assets such solar panels or insulation, to deployment of new agricultural and forestry methods.

Communities of enthusiasts could use virtual reality (metaverse) world to recreate past environments, by crowdsourcing its components. For instance, by rebuilding a city as it was when they were young, replete with the popular hangouts of the time as well as the soundscape and other paraphernalia (such as clothing, popular items etc). The same could be done for historical sites. The ability of new AI technology to create 3D models from 2D imagery will greatly simplify the work that amateurs could do, hence exponentially increasing the diversity and granularity that could be generated. Participants could be incentivized in the creation of VR models through the use of NFTs.

"Ed Hawkins, a climate scientist at the University of Reading in England, put out a call for help transcribing more than 65,000 handwritten logs of monthly rainfall, spanning three centuries, from across Britain and Ireland. The writing in the records was too irregular to be read by machine; human eyes were needed. More than 16,000 people answered Dr. Hawkins’s request, and together they chewed through the task in a little over two weeks. That was [...] during Britain’s first coronavirus lockdown. [By early 2022], the nation’s weather agency, the Met Office, [had] processed 3.3 million data points from the transcribed pages and added them to its national rainfall statistics, enriching the official record with many more observations and extending it back to 1836." (Source: The New York Times)

Use case: Using AI and collective behavior to drive financial alpha
Description: Renaissance's hedge fund is one of the most succesful financial players today. Their Medallion fund trades through algorithms that look at the patterns of reaction of human traders, and it is especially strong in times when humans panic. The algorithms' success shows that humans are most predictable in moments of panic, but financial markets do revert to the mean at some point. In the meantime, trading through that volatility could be very profitable, when done by machines that second guess the short term reactions of traders, and the longer term trend beyond that noise.

In order to combat disinformation and improving the nutritional education level, UK social innovation consulting Nesta organized a community of teens so they could detect potentially dangerous marketing practices.

Use case: De-risking building permissions to avoid archeological damage
Description: ArchAI automate the assessment of archaeological sites required by environmental impact assessments (EIAs) during the planning permission application process for construction projects within Europe. Pre-trained AI models can assess thousands of images instantly, providing rapid, accurate feedback to developers and project planners.ArchAI's latest project explores how crowd intelligence can help train the AI, explore large areas and create social impact. The project is led by Dig Ventures and funded by Nesta’s Collective Intelligence Grants programme, to explore how the collaborative power of Crowd Intelligence and Artificial Intelligence can be used to identify archaeology – and involve local people in the process.
DigVentures is a platform that enables civic participation in archaeology and heritage projects through crowdfunding, crowdsourcing actual digs, and training.

Use case: Assess the footprint of food recipes
Description: The University of Manchester and E.Mission tested whether a natural language processing model trained by a crowd can be used to calculate the carbon footprint of online recipes and suggest lower carbon substitutes, and whether this can lead to lower carbon cooking. (Source: Nesta UK)

The ACTION (www.actionproject.eu - participatory science toolkit against pollution) project brings together the needs of multiple stakeholders throughout the entire lifecycle of a citizen science project, creating methodologies, tools and guidelines that democratise the scientific process. The co-designed ACTION Accelerator programme supports local citizen science projects across Europe reaching communities that are underrepresented in science e.g. those with visual impairments, by providing intensive support, peer-to-peer mentoring and training when analysing or collecting data on various types of pollution.

Use case: Using web3 to build scientists' reputation
Description: Currently, scientists’ reputations — and as a result their ability to secure funding — are tied to publishing metrics. With blockchain technology, scientists could earn NFTs for doing other activities that research communities deem valuable, such as peer review, training and mentoring, and sharing data openly. NFT collections could act as a verifiable digital reputation for contributions, further incentivizing such behaviors. Scientists and groups of individuals with a shared wallet, such as a decentralized lab, could build reputation this way. Source: Sarah Hamburg.

Use case: Enhance demand flexibility and climate resilience in urban areas
Description: Collective intelligence is applied to manage the demand response among buildings. CI improves the autonomy in absorbing shocks without the need for upgrading the central control. Source: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apenergy.2020.116106

Search engines don't structure research topics well, but other NLP tools like Gyan.ai attempt to provide richer content quality by using a combination of web and database search, and knowledge graph technology.

J-Ventures is a community-driven global venture capital fund of top investors, executives and founders. Based in Silicon Valley, it operates as a collaborative community of leaders with shared values and a strong network of connected capital. They call themselves a "capitalist kibbutz".
GEDMatch enables people to find DNA relatives across many DNA databanks.
Cindicator uses superforecasters and machine learning to predict volatile crypto assets and guide trades.

OurCrowd is a crowdfunding site where the participants themselves vet investments collectively. Originated in Israel, the deal flow is weeded out by the community, and then what is left can be invested in by the members.

Distributed Denial of Secrets (ddosecrets.com) is a journalist 501(c)(3) non-profit devoted to enabling the free transmission of data in the public interest. It was involved in the assessment of the role of right wing platform Parler in the occupation of US Capital after Joe Biden's election to US President.
Digilantes, groups of people on social media who rally behind unsolved case, may have contributed to the retrieval of the remains of Gabby Petito who went missing during a trip.

Use case: Verify crowdsourced imagery by looking at the sun's shade
Description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) is increasingly used in the near-real-time analysis of the development of conflicts. Verifying the authenticity of imagery is a critical step in process. One way to do that is to use apps like SunCalc calculate the length of shades on ground at the alleged time of an event, and compare it with what's in the crowdsourced imagery.

Use case: Monitor sanctions during Ukraine's war through knowledge graphs
Description: Knowledge graph technology from Diffbot was used to monitor the impact of Western sanctions on specific companies, by surfacing and recombining natural language data from news and other web based sources.

Deployment of 5G in urban areas will decrease the signal transmission latency, which in turn could enable remote human controllers to take over autonomous vehicles in critical situations. German startup Vay started experimenting with fully remotely controlled vehicles in 2021.

So-called headless brands are increasingly important in consumer products, especially fashion and apparel. Decentralized, independent producers and influencers bypass or complement established brands and their marketing. Infrastructure like Metafactory helps them organize - throughout their supply chain, and thanks to crypto assets such as NFTs (non fungible tokens).

Use case: Improving quality and quantity of life
Description: Blue Zones (Okinawa, Loma Linda, Sardinia's Ogliastra etc) are areas where people live longer and healtier than what would be expected from the analysis of standard socioeconomic parameters. Those regions are distinctive because of their collective care traits, in addition to sustainable habits and type of food.

Use case: Improve the odds of business success
Description: Keith Ferrazzi's "Never eat alone" expounds a simple thesis: that professional success can be accelerated and amplified by intentionally and systematically scheduling meetings in the flow of life, which would then yield enough network cloud to access and execute advancement opportunities.
Almanis is a proprietary prediction market for real-time probability forecasts in: macroeconomics, geopolitics, corporate revenue and earnings.

Estimize crowdsources earnings and macroeconomic estimates from over 100,000 contributors across the globe. They welcome anyone to contribute in return for free access to their data and analytics tools, or one can simply pay to subscribe.
Premise.com and Streetbees.com innovate on the traditional consumer market research methocs by crowdsourcing research from a network of global contributors.

Metafluidics is a design repository where contributors can store their design of microfluids, and others can use them and develop them further. It is an open-source repository where you can upload the device designs for all kinds of fluidics systems, from diagnostic devices to devices for PCR, assembling DNA, or cell culture.
The Amsterdam data exchange enables interoperability between citizen user interfaces and the various city autorities, as well as with businesses and researchers.

Neighborhood level mesh networks could use the connectivity between public devices as a substitute or a complement to cellular and other WiFi data. Examples of infrastructure that supports this concept are Amazon Sidewalk, Apple AirTag and NYC mesh.

Use case: Improve GPT-3 models through a fine-tune market
Description: OpenAI GPT-3, a Transformer AI and one of the most advanced in the world, allows developers (including those without machine learning skills) to fine-tune their models by providing their data. Over time, developers may create markets where they exchange those models, possibly resulting in aggregate or meta-models.

Using open source intelligence became very common during the Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Primer's engineers modified [the] tools to carry out four new tasks: To gather audio captured from web feeds that broadcast communications captured using software that emulates radio receiver hardware; to remove noise, including background chatter and music; to transcribe and translate Russian speech; and to highlight key statements relevant to the battlefield situation. In some cases this involved retraining machine learning models to recognize colloquial terms for military vehicles or weapons". (Source: Wired Magazine)

Domino’s Pizza Enterprises, the Australian franchise of Domino’s, has taken digital technology one step further by leveraging crowds to create and market new types of pizzas. Through a mobile app called Pizza Mogul launched in 2014, Domino’s has encouraged Australian consumers to create and name new pizza combinations and market their ideas via social media.
Dust storms have been occurring with record-breaking frequency in 2019, according to data collected from Australian citizen-science DustWatch.
The Infomedusa program in Spain used natural language processing applied to social media to detect the onset of jellyfish arrival on its beaches.
The GLOBE at Night citizen science project allows individual observers to quantify skyglow using star maps showing different levels of light pollution.
LOC corwdsourcing organizes virtual volunteering to transcribe, review, and tag Library digital collections to improve discovery.

Use case: Crowdsource Predictors of Residential Electric Energy Usage
Description: Residential electricity users are able to contribute valuable consumption hypotheses and drivers that can inform modeling.
Crowdsourced data from actual turns at intersections, combined with other map data, can improve and update existing street maps.

Use case: Improve crop variety adaptation against climate change
Description: Farmers acting as citizen scientists have shown to be able to recommend actions that lead to better yield in the presence of climate change. Source: https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1813720116
Individual reports of food poisoning, when triangulated with location and time, can help narrow down on the sources of poisoning.

The US government's EPA's Collaborative seeks to expand activities related to the Internet of Water (IoW), a vision for improving data flow between typically fragmented water sectors, in order to proactively engage citizen science in non-governmental organizations (NGOs). Active facilitation by the Collaborative has allowed for seamless integration of water data into the IoW technical framework, maximizing the potential for data to be included in public policy and community decision-making.

Use case: Increase the effectiveness of autonomous devices
Description: Swarms of robots, using specific swarm-intelligence algorithms, are increasingly considered as a solution for patrolling or intervening in challenging areas - from military to environmental disasters to space mining, to more common agricultural yield improvement. For instance, Korean Air has implemented a solution for airplane maintenance checks that involves a small number of drones operating together around the aircraft, resulting in reduction of time per inspection.

OpenCageData consolidates open source geocoding data and makes its API commercially available in a way that simplifies access and provides quality control. The result is qualitatively comparable to traditional proprietary data (like Google's). This example is somewhat analogous to companies like RedHat have done with open source Linux code.

Use case: Accelerate climate technology transition by committing prices for future transactions
Description: Frontier is an advance market commitment to buy an initial $925M of permanent carbon removal between 2022 and 2030, hence bringing forward a market incentive to providers of solutions. It’s funded by Stripe (who also owns it), Alphabet, Shopify, Meta, McKinsey, and tens of thousands of businesses using Stripe Climate. Frontier is an advance market commitment (AMC) that aims to accelerate the development of carbon removal technologies by guaranteeing future demand for them. The goal is to send a strong demand signal to researchers, entrepreneurs, and investors that there is a growing market for these technologies. Importantly, Frontier aims to help create net new carbon removal supply rather than compete over what exists today. In practice, its team of technical and commercial experts facilitates purchases from high-potential carbon removal companies on behalf of buyers.

OpenAI's Dall-E2 uses transformer technologies to create visual artifacts - art, for example. Instead of combining natural language (which the pre-existing transformer GPT-3 does), it recombines images that it has been trained on.

Blockchain based Miamicoins is an example of the possibility to generate liquidity for local markets, enabling authorities, businesses and citizens to use them to address their specific needs. Miamicoins' smart contract enabled the community to allocate resources toward fighting the impact of climate change on Miami, among others. Kenya's Sarafu is an example of local currency serving 50,000 users.

Use case: Enable central banks to issue cryptocurrencies
Description: Crypto based digital currencies are central bank's cryptocurrencies. They are an effort to modernize the monetary system, but also come with the risk of adding public control in nondemocratic ways.

Use case: Verify provenance and authenticity of web information
Description: The Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity is a consortium backed by ARM, Twitter and Microsoft that issued a protocol with guidelines for disclosure of information. This protocol uses a technique called hard binding, which uses crypotgraphy to encode and bind information together to facilitate auditability. The News Provenance Project uses cryptography to provide confidence on news reporting.
Explorer.land inventories nature rewilding projects and maps them globally, to help inspire and foster collaboration.

KelpWatch.org maps kelp forests and their evolution with geospatial data, to help organizations protect those ecosystems as they're particularly effective at sequesting carbon but they are endangered by the rise of water temperature.

Use case: Safely share healthcare data for machine learning
Description: PriCell is a model that employs homomorphic multiparty encryption to enable safe share of sensitive healthcare data for use in federated learning (source: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.patter.2022.100487 )
Zama enables web2 and web3 to use full homomorphic encryption without needing to learn cryptography
Cryptocurrency Zcash allocates a percentage of each new block to community developers, in order to provide adequate extrinsic incentives for development and maintenance done by them.

Blockchain DeFi (decentralized finance) includes decentralized exchanges (DEX) where market participants trade directly with each other without the need of a central clearinghouse (e.g. the New York Exchange). When doing so, they rely on Automated Market Making (AMM) that is an algorithm that provides the liquidity for buy / sell positions without the need of physical market makers.

Many cryptocurrencies require zero privacy in the transactions. Companies like Context and Chainalytics enable the monitoring of transactions, including the watch of where specific individuals transact - which can sometime be valuable insight.

Historical formation of collectiveintelligence: 16th century England and Netherlands' market-economy networks boosted incentives for education, which drove investment in learning institutions, and ultimately paved way to modern political institutions.
Composer is a platform for financial investors aimed at making hedge fund strategies accessible by more people. Some of the strategies they offer are crowdsourced from their own investor community.

Use case: Form stronger social bonds in physical spaces
Description: Zenly is a mobile social app that helps users map their locations, and those of their friends, to make them meet more easily and curate information about their location habits. The aggregation of the information provides a unique user experience to the members.

Joro.app helps consumer track their personal carbon footprint by translating purchases data (from an API) into carbon tonnes equivalent. The app also has a community component, connecting users with sustainability challenges, classes and other educational tools, along with a social network to communicate with peers to track relative progress (Source: TechCrunch).

As of 2022, about half of all active crypto wallets were part of decentralized apps (dApps) specific to gaming. This drives an enormous amount of financial interaction in conjunction with social gaming. The combined dynamics of community and market for games open numerous possibilities for commerce, learning and others.
Censoredplanet.org uses measurement techniques, including toils like Augur, to detect instances of internet censorship across the world.

Indonesia's commercial drivers organically created a supporting community centered around Twitter, called Gojer on Twit (GoT). The organization helped them counter the information advantage that ride-hailing algorithms have over individual workers.

Use case: Build a community in your inbox
Description: Superhive simplifies the user experience of participating in a community by automating the aggregation and sharing of simple requests made by community members in a periodic email newsletter. The upside is that user don't need to leave their email environment to interact.

http://scenicornot.datasciencelab.co.uk/ crowdsources opinions about the beauty of places in the UK, by asking users to simply rate the beauty of a picture on a website. The data has been combined with geospatial data to evaluate the scenic beauty of places.

Perlara coordinates the activities of decentralized biotechnology research teams composed by researchers and entrepreneurial families focused on finding cures for their relatives. The objective is to achieve precision medicines at scale.

Use case: Find cures to rare diseases through pioneering therapies
Description: Phage therapy is the use of bacteriophages (viruses that target bacteria) to treat bacterial infections in humans or animals.  Phage Directory includes 448 phage researchers and 100 phage organizations. Its model is simple: a decentralized, global network of scientists with potential cures, an alert system, and a template for shepherding treatments from the lab to the exam room. This network has delivered three separate “n-of-1” cures under compassionate use or experimental therapy guidelines. In other words, they’ve produced individually tailored treatments for patients who’d exhausted all other options (like antibiotics). Phage Directory is now working on an academic medical network funded by the Australian government. (Source:A16z, company website)

In a climate change scenario, viruses are likely to be spread as species move to other locales driven by environmental changes (temperature in particular). The network effects will be complex to model.

The Indian government started in the early 2010s an extensive labeling and testing effort for refrigeration devices, in order to spur innovation and adoption of energy efficient devices. These signaling and certification mechanism drove change in behavior of both supplier and consumers, resulting in a significant improvement of the energy efficiency of these devices in India.

Edge computing will enable devices to use information and models built centrally, while maintaining a decentralized data set that isn't shared with any central computer. The result is more private use of powerful AI driven applications.

Low latency networks and edge computing will enable groups of decentralized machines (e.g., drones) to operate in orchestrated and effective fashion, for instance in the case of detecting and countering fire hazard over large expanses, or conversely when operating small devices inside the human body.

Use case: Support invention in risky and easy-to-copy fields
Description: Protection of intellectual property rights, for instance through patents, incentivize market players to invest in inventing new solutions. The impact on market innovativeness can be positive, especially in areas where the investments and risk of failure are high, but where the ability to reverse engineer and copy the output is also high (e.g. pharma).

Use case: Summarizing the insights for climate change science
Description: The IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel for Climate Change) report, for instance its major 2022 release, is a global effort to summarize the entire scientific fact base around climate science, in an attempt to influence public policy and industry strategy. Its output is an inventory of the research published and its principal conclusions.
DClimate.net is a marketplace of decentralized climate data for data science work. It uses Ethereum to enable buying/selling transactions. -

Huggingface.co uses a community to inventory mostly Natural Language Processing (NLP) code, especially pretrained models for specific use cases and hardware. The community also helps making the code better. Its infrastructure shares commonalities with GitHub.

Use case: Design new technology inspired by nature
Description: Biomimicry.org inventories natural designs that have the potential to inform human design of new engineering concepts, hence fostering new possibilities for "interspecies intelligence".

Use case: Host fully free social media speech
Description: Mastodon.social is a social media network where decentralized "instances", groups of users, define norms for speech and enforce them. The actual running of the technology for those instances is done on separate, individual servers.

Peer review systems in Human Resources management (e.g. 360-degree assessment), when executed well, allow individual professionals to obtain constructive feedback that helps improve their abilities by helping them focus on their performance gaps. Such systems also can foster a culture of collaboration across groups, by clarifying that feedback will not only be hierarchical.

Hundreds of thousands of community land trusts exist in the world today in an attempt to make housing more affordable and prevent speculation that can displace local residents, hence enabling them to root and create better community dynamics. Community-owned land is built upon, at their expense, by the house owner. When the owner wants to sell, they can do so within a process that prevents speculation and gives rights of first refusal to neighbors.

Fitness app Strava has a number of social features that motivate users to come back. For instance, members can suggest routes for running or cycling, and encourage each other, particularly in a local area.
Social media app Stocktiwts is in many ways similar to Twitter focuses on stocks, and features private rooms where influencers can guide individual investors.

Social commerce Depop focuses on fashion e.g. apparel, and enables users to contribute to fashion design, as well as to obtain style suggestions. It was acquired by distributed-creativity marketplace Etsy in 2021.

Academia.edu, a portal providing a large array of scientific publications, offers "summaries" of research as a premium service, enabling the swift identification and combination of relevant ideas across a large corpus of knowledge.

GoodCarbon offers access to existing and emerging natural climate solution projects and related carbon streams across soil and soil and forest ecoysytems. Its platform intends to bring transparency and liquidity to this part of the carbon offset market.

Decentralized.science provides a public repository of Open Peer Reviews and a reviewers’ reputation network, and uses blockchain to maintain records. Decentralized science rewards good and fast peer reviews to increase the quality and productivity of academic research

Blockchain based LabDAO is an open, community-run network of wet & dry laboratory services to advance progress in the life sciences. "LabDAO is a DeSci (decentralized science) organization that is focused on the execution layer of the scientific process. It intends to bridge the gap between the stages of funding scientific research and distributing it. By connecting scientific researchers using blockchain technology, LabDAO aims to build a peer-to-peer ‘marketplace’ for scientists to trade and share tools that can be used to further research and development (R&D)" (Source:LifeSpan.io)
